Patent Information.Patent Title: Anti-endotoxic antimicrobial cationic peptides and methods of use therfor.
Patent Information.Abstract: A novel class of cationic peptides having antimicrobial activity is provided. Exemplary peptides of the invention include KWKSFIKKLTSAAKKVVTTAKPLALIS (SEQ ID NO:3) and KGWGSFFKKAAHVGKHVGKAALTHYL (SEQ ID NO:15). Also provided are methods for inhibiting the growth of bacteria utilizing the peptides of the invention. Such methods are useful for the treatment of respiratory infections, such as in cystic fibrosis patients. Such methods are further useful for accelerating wound healing.

Sequence Information.Target Organism: Gram-negative bacteria:Escherichia coli (MIC=2.2-3.3 µM), Leucothrix mucor (MIC>35.0 µM), Serratia marcescens (MIC>35.0 µM), Pseudomonas aeruginosa (MIC>35.0 µM), Aeromonas salmonicida (MIC=17.7-35.0 µM), Cytophaga aquatilis (MIC=2.2-4.4 µM), Pasteurella haemolytica (MIC=4.4-8.8 µM), Salmonella typhimurium I (MIC=8.8-17.7 µM), Salmonella typhimurium II (MIC=8.8-17.7 µM);Gram-positive bacteria:Bacillus subtilis (MIC=1.1-2.2 µM), Staphylococcus aureus (MIC=17.7-35.0 µM).
Sequence Information.Hemolytic Activity: No hemolysis information or data found in the reference(s) presented in this entry
Sequence Information.Structure Description: From NMR structural studies with the uniformly (15)N-labeled peptide, a structure of pleurocidin is determined to be in a random coil conformation in aqueous solution whereas it assumes an alpha-helical structure in TFE and in dodecylphosphocholine (DPC) micelles.(Ref.2)
Sequence Information.Comments: May play a role in innate host defense.

Literature.Title: Isolation and characterization of pleurocidin, an antimicrobial peptide in the skin secretions of winter flounder.
Literature.Author: Cole A.M, Weis P, Diamond G.
